---------------------------------------------------------------------
Swirling atmospherics and mantra-like lyrics abound on Mercury Rev&#039;s newest 
work &#039;&#039;Snowflake Midnight.&#039;&#039; Recorded almost exclusively in the band&#039;s 
Catskills, N.Y. laboratory, &#039;&#039;Snowflake Midnight&#039;&#039; sees MR continue 
experiments with laser harps, ad-hoc computer programs and random note 
generators resulting in a record that moves with grace between avant garde 
and traditional pop sensibilities. Standout tracks &#039;&#039;Butterfly&#039;s Wing&#039;&#039; and 
&#039;&#039;Senses on Fire&#039;&#039; exhibit the emphasis on letting the music define itself, as 
free as possible from human interference. Zooming in at nearly any 
magnification, &#039;&#039;Snowflake Midnight&#039;&#039; appears to be a resplendent fractal 
folding in upon itself, into something continually new, unpredictable and 
spontaneous, and yet so subtly self-aware, that it never fails to resemble 
itself as a whole.
